Marking of high voltage components and wiring

The ‘High Voltage’ symbol shall appear preferably on or near the high voltage battery pack.

The same symbol shall be visible on barriers and enclosures, which, when removed, expose live parts of high voltage electric circuits. Accessibility and removability of barriers/enclosures should be considered when evaluating the requirement for the symbol.

The outer covering of cables and harness for high voltage electric circuits not within enclosures or behind barriers shall be marked with orange color. High voltage connectors may be identified by the harnesses to which the connector is attached.

Permanent marking on the pack

The following permanent markings shall be placed on the pack:

  • the manufacturer’ s name, trade name, trademark, or other descriptive marking which may identify the organization responsible for the product, part number, or model number
  • electrical ratings in volts dc and AH or WH
  • chemistry of the pack (i.e. lithium ion, ni-cad, etc.)
  • date of manufacture, this may be in the form of code that does not repeat within 10 years
  • Identification and if applicable polarity markings on all external terminals and connections
  • marking of the point of connection to the charger grounding system by “Ground”, or “G”, or “GR” or identified by a distinctive green color
  • identification of the hazardous voltage circuits on the pack. The following markings can be used: sentence “Warning: Hazardous Voltage Circuits” or the electric shock hazards symbol.
